redeem.title: Redeem Code
redeem.tipEmpty: Tip: Paste the code or type it in uppercase.
redeem.tipLooksGood: Looks good. You can redeem now.

referral.title: Referral Program
referral.copyLinkDesc: Click the copy button to get your personal link.
referral.shareDesc: Send the link to your friends via your channels.
referral.earnDesc: When friends purchase any plan, both of you get points.
referral.myInviteDesc: Share your invite code with friends. When they buy any plan, you get 2000 credits and your friend gets 1000 credits.
referral.editDesc: You can change your invite code only once. Use uppercase letters and digits (A–Z, 0–9), at least {min} characters.

apiKeys.intro: Manage your API keys for accessing our services

empty.title: No API Keys Yet
empty.desc: Create your first API key to start using our services programmatically

apiKeys.option1Recommended: Option 1 (Recommended): Download the LTS installer from https://nodejs.org, run the installer and follow default steps.
apiKeys.option2DownloadPkg: Option 2: Download the LTS installer (.pkg) from https://nodejs.org and follow the instructions.

linux.installHint: Use your distribution's package manager, then verify with node --version. Examples:

apiKeys.noteDesc: Your koi.codes API key can be used in Codex, Claude Code, and Gemini.

oneClick.installedOk: If you see a version like v18.0.0, Node.js is installed.
oneClick.installNode: If not installed, download and install the LTS version from https://nodejs.org, then restart your terminal.

apiKeys.morePlatforms: For other platforms and troubleshooting, see

windows.runAsAdmin: If permission issues occur, run PowerShell as Administrator.

codex.createAuth: Then create a new ~/.codex/auth.json with the following content:
codex.deleteAuth: Delete any existing auth.json under ~/.codex (if present), then create a new auth.json.
codex.configImportantDesc: The config file must be named config.toml and use TOML format. Do not create config.json or other formats.
codex.deleteConfig: Delete any existing config.toml under ~/.codex (if present), then create a new config.toml.
codex.createConfig: Then create a new ~/.codex/config.toml with the content below:

gemini.noteDesc: Your koi.codes API key can be used in Codex, Claude Code, and Gemini.
gemini.permanentNote: After setting, restart PowerShell for changes to take effect.

details.title: Credits Details
details.emptyDesc: You haven’t used any credits yet — try unlocking premium features now!

guide.title: Help & Support
guide.subtitle: A quick tour of account basics and setup
guide.noteDesc: Create an API key and finish VSCode/CLI setup before daily use.

account.title: Account Usage
account.p1: Register with email and start after verification.
account.p2: New users get 500 credits (about 60–100 requests for non‑Opus models).

quoteFree.title: Free trial?
quoteFree.body: Yes. New users get about 60–100 free requests. If your invitee makes any purchase, you get 260–400 extra requests, and your friend gets 130–200 extra requests. Even a $1 independent credit pack triggers rewards.

quoteInvite.title: When are invite rewards granted?
quoteInvite.body: Rewards are granted to both sides after the invitee completes a paid order.

usage.title: How to Use
usage.p1: Use the official client and set required environment variables.
usage.p2: You can also try by setting API‑related environment variables.

vscode.title: VSCode Extension
vscode.desc: Use Claude Code in VSCode for a smoother coding experience.

install.title: Install Extension
install.step1: 1. Search "Claude Code" in VSCode Marketplace or visit the extension page

config.title: Configure Environment Variables
config.step1: 1. Open VSCode Settings (Cmd+, or Ctrl+,) or Preferences -> Settings
config.step2: 2. Search ‘claude code’ and click ‘Edit in settings.json’
config.step3: 3. Add the following config to settings.json:

apikey.title: Configure API Key
apikey.step2: 2. Add your API key from koi.codes:

start.title: Get Started
start.desc: Restart VSCode to use Claude Code directly in the editor.

cli.title: CLI Tool
cli.desc: Use Claude Code via the command line—great for terminal lovers.

config.title: Configuration
config.line2: 2. Add API key and Base URL

use.title: Usage
use.desc: Run ‘claude’ in your terminal to start chatting.

models.title: Available Models
models.line1: Opus: most capable but higher cost; excellent research ability.
models.line2: Sonnet: balanced performance and cost; great for daily work.
models.note: Note: The Claude Code client may call Haiku automatically for content review, summaries, titles, and cache creation. Seeing Haiku requests when closing the terminal is normal.

credits.title: What do credits mean? How do they relate to tokens?
credits.line1: Credits and tokens are not directly convertible.
credits.line4: Therefore credits and tokens cannot be directly converted, nor guarantee daily usage time.

start.title: Start Chatting
start.desc: Describe your question in the chat box and Claude will respond with details and code examples.

plans.title: Plan Selection
plans.desc: We offer two flexible billing options: subscription credits and independent credits.

subscription.title: Subscription Credits
subscription.line1: Credits are issued hourly during the subscription period.
subscription.line2: Once the cap is reached, they don’t auto‑recover.

independent.title: Independent Credits
independent.line1: Never expire; if the subscription expires, priority decreases.
independent.line2: Free users’ priority does not guarantee stability and speed.

recommend.title: Recommendations
recommend.line1: Work coding only: choose Plus and use Sonnet.
recommend.line2: Work coding + side projects: choose Pro.
recommend.line3: Researchers: choose Max; Sonnet is not ideal for research/innovation.

get.title: Get Codes
get.desc: Obtain codes from official events, partners, or trusted third‑party channels.

steps.title: Redemption Steps
steps.s1: 1. Go to My Subscription and open Redeem Code
steps.s2: 2. Enter the code and click Redeem
steps.s3: 3. On success, credits or plan take effect immediately

faq.title: FAQ
faq.desc: If the code is invalid or expired, check the input or contact support.
